data.question: What is the highest proton conductivity value achieved among the coordination polymers mentioned?
Which coordination polymer has the highest proton conductivity under 80 88C and 98% relative humidity?
What role do the templated polycarboxylate anions play in the coordination polymers?
data.answer: They play a significant role in crystal packing and formation of well-directed H-bonded networks, enhancing proton conduction.

data.question: True or False: Nafion and Nafion-like polymer membranes are mentioned as efficient proton conductors.
What is the molecular formula of the coordination polymer synthesized with benzene tetra-carboxylate (btec)?
True or False: The proton conductivity of all three coordination polymers is highly dependent on humidity.
What is the activation energy for Co-fdc?
How does the proton conductivity of Co-tri compare to Co-tetra at 40 88C and 98% R.H.?
data.answer: Co-tri has a higher proton conductivity than Co-tetra.

data.question: True or False: The proton conduction study was carried out using the DC impedance method.
What is the effect of temperature on the proton conductivity of the coordination polymers?
data.answer: The proton conductivity increases with increasing temperature.

data.question: True or False: Co-tri and Co-tetra exhibit excellent proton conductivity at ambient temperature.
What is the main mechanism of proton conduction in these coordination polymers?
True or False: The coordination polymers contain long-range proton transport species.
What is the significance of the protonated template Hbtc2@ in Co-tri?
data.answer: It facilitates proton transport through formation of highly competent H-bonded pathways for enhanced conductivity.

data.question: True or False: The coordination polymers were synthesized at high temperatures.
What is the role of water molecules in the proton conduction of these coordination polymers?
data.answer: Water molecules help the diffusion of protons and serve as mediators through hydrogen bond formation.

data.question: True or False: The coordination polymers exhibit identical supramolecular laminate structures.
What is the stability temperature of Co-tri before starting to decompose?
How does the proton conductivity of Co-fdc compare to Co-tetra under 80 88C and 98% R.H.?
data.answer: Co-tetra has a higher proton conductivity than Co-fdc.
